column5: Hey there I need to run a fire systems check at work . I was shown once very very quickly be for the other guy suddenly retired . Now he is gone and it is my job to run the test  I have to pull a station and reset it I have included a picture of the station I cannot fid a name on it and I need to be able to reset it  I know he used a screwdriver. I think he just flipped something inside then closed the door . any help would be great
should be a flat head screw on top or on the side  turn it and the front will open then its just a switch
no screws on outside I'm sure of it  I know the guy actually pulled the alarm

there is a small hole on the top or side where you push in the small screwdriver and by pressing the spring mechanism close the latch.     similar to 3:55 mark,  only this one has the small hole in the front.     most of the time there are instructions on the inside.
Sorry then not the same as I have at work,looked the same.
I looked real close at it today at work and there is no holes it it at all
if there is no screw on top or hole on side or bottom, I see no glass rod so it could be one that you just pull and then push back in to rest...
skinny this is a mirtone 73303 pull station, easy to use and reset, instructions are on the inside of the pull station once you pull it but heres a video!    hope this helps
Thanks guys I knew I could get answers
